bibl.title: Bunnell and Bunnell v. Isbell. Petition for Writ
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

org.orgName: United States District Court For The Western District of Washington Northern Division

div1.p: of Washington approved Feb. 2" 1888 after the incorporation of the town as aforesaid the trustees met and ordained by ordinance "3" Sect. "2" of the ordinances of the town of Garfield in relation to city clerk as follows: "He shall enter in the docket the title of every action for the violation of any town ordinance commenced in his Court and act as police Judge and make such other entries therein as an required to be made in the docket of a Justice of the Peace by the laws of the Territory." Seciton "6" of Article "3" of the Ordinaces of said town provides It shall be the duty of the town clerk in his capacity as magistrate to act as Police Judge of said town and to hear and determine all cases under the town ordinances and his court shall be governed by the Laws of Washington Territory pertaining to Justice of the Peace". That your petitioners over that the acts of said town inthe appointment of the city clerk as police Judge are illegal; that on the first day of September A.D. 1888 a complaint was filed with Thomas Kennedy, Town Clerk of the said town of Garfield in his pretendt capactiy of Police Judge charging the Defendants of violationy Section "12" of ordinance "8" of said town upon the filing of the aforesaid complaint
